info.name: API Prototyping
info.description: > Prototyping your API in Postman streamlines the development process by enabling you to design and test front- and back-end API-driven functionalities within a shared workspace. ## **ü™ê Get started** This collection serves as a place for teams from the Intergalactic Bank to collaborate on the design of the soon-to-be-developed Intergalactic Bank API. This prototype collection outlines how the service's requests and responses should function. Stakeholders should provide their thoughts and suggestions before we begin development. ## **üßë‚Äçüíª Setting up a mock server** This collection is meant to be used alongside a [Postman Mock Server](https://learning.postman.com/docs/designing-and-developing-your-api/mocking-data/setting-up-mock/)**.** Since we are still in the planning phase of the API, we have included several example responses for each request, laying out how we think each possible response will look. Including these example responses also has the added benefit of powering a mock server. By following the instructions, you can set up your own mock server and simulate the behavior of this API by returning the predefined data. **To set up a mock server:** 1. Select **Mock collection** from the collection's actions menu. 2. On the **Create a mock server** page, add a name for your mock server, and select to **Save the mock server URL as a new environment variable.** This will create a new environment with the mock‚Äôs URL pre-populated. 3. Select the **New Environment** from the **Environment** dropdown list. 4. Complete the process by clicking **Create Mock Server**. 5. Send the request! You should now see that the `{{url}}` variable is using the mock server you set up previously. 6. Try editing fields in the mocked responses to see your changes reflected in the mock server. ## **ü§îWhy include tests?** Each request in the collection includes tests to check the response structure. These tests check that all of the properties that other systems rely on are present and of the expected data type. Once you have the fully built-out service in place, you can swap the mock server URL for the live URL and test that your implementation follows the same guidelines as your prototype. This gives you confidence that you can start integrating this service into your systems. If you are adding a new proposed endpoint for this request, try asking Postbot to generate tests for it. ## **ü§ùCollaborate with us!** The Bank Services team wants your team‚Äôs input on our API design. Add an [inline comment](https://learning.postman.com/docs/collaborating-in-postman/working-with-your-team/discussing-your-work/) to this collection with your ideas, questions, and suggestions, or reach out to us on our internal Slack by tagging `@bank-services`.

item.name: Transactions

pm.test("Response is an object with transactions property", function () {

request.description:
This endpoint will create a new transaction. Funds will be transferred between accounts by providing two account IDs in the `fromAccountId` and `toAccountId` fields.

### Important!

Transactions cannot be edited once created, so use this endpoint with caution.

response.name: Insufficient funds
Forbidden

item.description: A transaction records money moving in or out of an account. Transactions at the Intergalactic Bank should follow a blockchain-like approach. Once created, they cannot be updated or deleted, so we will have only endpoints to get or create transactions.

item.name: Accounts

exec: // Test to check the structure of the successful response
pm.test("Response body structure is valid", function () {

query.description: (Optional) filter by full name of the account owner
(Optional) filter for accounts created on or after date (YYYY-MM-DD)

request.description: This endpoint will list all accounts that exist at the Intergalactic Bank. Optionally, filter by `owner` (using a full name), or the `createdAt` date (using `YYYY-MM-DD` format).

response.name: Forbidden

exec: // Test the response body structure and values
pm.test("Response body structure is valid", function () {

request.description: This endpoint will retrieve information about an account by passing the account `id` as a path parameter.

response.name: Forbidden

exec: // Test to check the structure of the successful response
pm.test("Successful response has the correct structure", function () {
// Check if the response contains the account object
// Check the properties of the account object

request.description:
This endpoint will update information about an account by passing the `accountId` as a path parameter and additional information through the Request Body.

### Request Body Properties

| **Property Name** | **Data Type** | **Description** | **Required?** |
| --- | --- | --- | --- |
| owner | String | Full Name | Yes |

### Important!

Only Bank Admins have permission to update an account. You may encounter a `403 Forbidden Error` if you try to update an account without the correct permissions.

response.name: Forbidden

exec: pm.test("Response body to be empty", function () {

request.description:
This endpoint will delete an account by passing in the account `id` as a path parameter.

### Important!

Once an account is deleted, it cannot be restored, so please use this endpoint with caution.

Additionally, only bank admins have permission to update an account. You may encounter a `403 Forbidden` error if you try to update an account without the correct permissions.

response.name: Forbidden

exec: // Test the structure of the successful response
pm.test("Response body structure is valid", function () {

request.description:
This endpoint will create a new account at the Intergalactic Bank.

### Request Body Properties

| Property Name | Property Type | **Description** | **Required?** |
| --- | --- | --- | --- |
| owner | String | Full name of the person opening this account | Yes |
| balance | Number | The starting balance of the account | Yes |
| currency | String - Possible values: `COSMIC_COINS`, `GALAXY_GOLD`, `MOON_BUCKS` | The currency this account will be using for transactions. This cannot be changed once established. | Yes |

response.name: Forbidden

item.description: An Account at the Intergalactic Bank allows you to store funds. Account endpoints return information about accounts and account holders at the Intergalactic Bank. They should not return information about transactions. Instead, all transaction information should be accessed by requests in the `Transactions` folder.
